our contributor ladder so this is the this is the process and
kind of a path that we have created as far as allowing contributors to kind of understand how
our project is organized and to facilitate growth within the project so
when somebody starts out new they're a non-member contributor when
once you've kind of got some um contributions under your belt you've developed some relationships you can get
some sponsors to put in an application to become an org member once you become an org member there's some benefits
there like we trust the tests that you're running um and so you don't need to wait for
somebody to okay that it's like safe to test your your pr um we also um it allows you to become
members of some of our github teams so you can be pinged on particular things if you're interested in in particular
areas of the project you know as you continue growing you might become a reviewer
reviewers are kind of our front line as far as triaging incoming prs providing first levels of guidance as far as you
know co-correctness completion um uh all that kind of stuff and we we
actually record in our owner's file section like who is reviewers for a particular area and who is able to kind
of give that guidance continuing your undergrowth you become the next step as an approver approvers
are people who actually have commit rights to a repo um so the the people who have approver rights over a
particular part of the code it doesn't necessarily need to be an entire repo but people who have approval rights over
um part of our code base they are people who are you know extremely trusted have lots of
experience with a particular area of the code um and that we are delegating that
like for that part of the code um you can actually do that final approval to say yes this is safe to merge and and to
tell our bots and automation to go and merge it and kind of at the top rung of that
ladder is sub project owner so our sub project owners are the people who are setting uh the
kind of the vision for a particular area of code they're the people who are who are um
coordinate kind of those larger like design architectural kind decisions for that part of the code um they're also
people who are going to liaise with other sub-project owners other parts of the code base um those are those are the
kind of primary contacts for a particular sub project and making sure that it's running properly as well as
doing some of the reporting back to the special interest group that oversees that part of the code base
